data types.number: numerical data in a form of an integer or a float
data types.string: any set of characters enclosed with ''

methods.append(): appends an item to a list
methods.items(): returns key-value pairs from a dictionary
methods.lower(): converts string value into a lower case
methods.remove(): removes an item from a list by value
methods.title(): converts string value into a title case
methods.upper(): converts string value into an upper case

miscallenous.constant: variable whose value stays the same throughout the life of a program, written in all caps
miscallenous.dictionary: data structure that allows for mapping key-value pairs
miscallenous.f-string: formatted string, variable name is replaced with value
miscallenous.float: any number with a decimal point
miscallenous.range(): function that returns values within given range - [x,y)
miscallenous.set: data structure in which each item must be unique
